Definitions








Freire framework
Definitions of reproducibilty





Repeatable
Reproducible (same data, same analysis)
GitHub Repo or OSF project


Re-runnable
Robust & Replicable (same code, different data/analysis/parameters)
Documentation, functions


Portable
Not considered (same code/data, different environment)
requirements.txt, Dockerfile


Extendable
(partly) Generalisable



Modifiable
(partly) Generalisable














Source: https://book.the-turing-way.org/reproducible-research/code-reuse

title: Making Code Ready for Publication
text:
Relative Paths

Everything should be runnable from the top folder of the project. Put data in data/ folder. Use relative paths from the top project folder:

my_data <- readr::read_csv("data/datafile.csv")

Ensures portability of project

Example of a reproducible project:
https://github.com/biodev/beataml2_manuscript
